result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: to Judge Grau form C.K. dated 3/9/16 - includes 15CM1608, 15CM1854, 15CM2220, 15CM2253
to Judge Grau from C.K. - includes 15CM1608, 15CM1854, 15CM2220, 15CM2253 - stj
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:32 am
INCLUDES 15CM1608, 15CM1854, 15CM2220, 15CM2253, 16CM321, 15TR3057, AND 15TR3134. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner. Def appears in person with Atty Robin Kennedy.  

INITIAL APPEARANCE IN 16CM321. 
State notes 16CM321 takes the place of 15TR3057. 
Atty Kennedy states she is in receipt of complaint and notes def intends to enter guilty plea. 

PLEA HEARING IN ALL. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CM1608: Ct. 1 (DC/DA)>>DELETE DA enhancer. 
In 15CM1854: Ct. 1 (Fraud on Taxicab Operator)>>D&RI. 
                       : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM2220: Ct. 2 (Criminal Damage to Property)>>D&RI. 
                       : Ct. 3 (Entry into bldg/constuct.site/room)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM2253: Ct. 1 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15TR3057: Ct. 1 (OWI 1st)>>DISMISS with understand that 16CM321 takes its place. 
In 15TR3134: Ct. 1 (Refusal)>>FOUND LAWFUL. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CM1608: Amended Ct. 1 (DC)>>GUILTY. 
In 15CM2220: Ct. 1 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling)>>GUILTY. 
                       : Ct. 4 (Misd. BJ)>>GUILTY. 
                       : Ct. 5 (Misd. BJ)>>GUILTY. 
In 16CM321: Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS:  In 15CM1608 and 15CM2220: SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS ON ALL: undergo random UAs; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; DNA sample and surcharge; CC including 1 DA surcharge. 
                             In 16CM321: SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS in 16CM321 ONLY: 45 days MCJ with huber for work/treatment/counseling/AA if def qualifies w/ 4 days credit; $1744 inclusive; 24 months dl revocation w/ admin credit; Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 24 months, as is the defendant herself, and device to be installed within 14 days of today's date; $50 IID installation fee to be paid; AODA - already completed and must be in complaince with driver's safety plan; $50 IID surcharge; absolute sobriety; 6 pts against dl. 
COURT ORDERS probations concurrent to each other. 

Adj: 11:50 am
for adjournment of JT on 12/9/15 by Atty Kennedy - granted
to Judge Grau from C.L.K. - includes 15CM1608, 15CM1854, 15TR3057, 15TR3134

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM1608, 15CM1854, 15TR3057 and 15TR3134 called: 2:47pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant does not appear - Atty Robin Kennedy does not appear.

State notes information from Atty Kennedy regarding non-appearance by defendant -- both counsel requesting that matter continue until next date already set for FPT.
COURT grants - bond continues.

Adj: 2:48pm

No contact with victim(s):  All American Taxi.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
